page.title: 11 VOLUNTARY SERVICES ii
page.content: We interviewed Mrs A.Cameron, the organiser of voluntary services at Barnes Hospital. This is a geriatric hospital of 60 beds, built around 1900 as a fever hospital. Mrs Cameron recruits, trains and supervises about 40 volunteers. There are 3 wards - 1 for long-stay patients, 2 for ill over-65s who can hope to return to the community (there are well-equipped occupational and physio-therapy depts.) The volunteers cheer up a place already improved by the greater understanding of the needs of old people. They run a weekly tea-bar, hold bingo sessions, sing-songs and ambulance outings. One runs "reminiscence" afternoons. The League of Friends raises money for non-NHS luxuries - an electric typewriter, a raised garden. In addition to the 60 beds, there is a Day Hospital.
